website_summaries.verdict: Designed for comfort with the popular domed split keyboard keyboard design of other Microsoft ergonomic  keyboards, this model stands out for its stylish appearance and Bluetooth connectivity.
pros: Compatible with all Bluetooth devices operating on any version Windows 10, Surface offers users increased device options
The unique gray color is aesthetically pleasing, and also makes key labels stand out more than traditional black keyboards
Wrists are kept in a comfortable position when typing by the familiar domed split keyboard layout, and the cushioned palm rest provides additional comfort for long work sessions
cons: Bluetooth can only be pared with one device at a time, forcing users to disconnect and reconnect when switching between devices

customer_reviews.title: I forgot how liberating it feels to actually have a working reliable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Using this keyboard was such a miserable experience that I had to give it up. There was just too many connectively problems. It would constantly disconnect and reconnecting it to bluetooth proved to be extremely frustrating. After several months, I just called it quits. I forgot how liberating it feels to actually have a working reliable keyboard that would not consistently disconnect at the worst possible times.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Truly a piece of junk. Lag is awful. Skips first couple of letters when typing
customer_reviews.text: Waaaaaay too much money to not work consistently every time. Often have to type the first letter of a word a few times before the keyboard works. Make sure to check each time you initially type for missing letters or lagging. Would not recommend this keyboard or buy it again. * Update one month later: Okay, I've lived with this for just long enough that I missed the return period. My bad. Truly this is a piece of junk. Stay away. I am buying a wireless ergonomic keyboard to preserve my sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza G

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the N.American version
customer_reviews.text: Careful who you order through as you may end up with a different version than what you thought. Nothing in the description stated that I would be receiving the UK keyboard layout with 105 keys instead of the North American 104 key layout.
customer_reviews.author: Frozen

customer_reviews.title: Repeatedly disconnected, failed to connect at startup
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard and/or Windows 10's Bluetooth software don't work correctly so the keyboard repeatedly disconnects and doesn't connect at startup. I have been taking my old keyboard out of storage every time I start up the computer to log in and reconnect the Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboard once I'm logged in (by resetting the Bluetooth settings). This would be a great product with a dedicated USB Bluetooth connection, but it seems Microsoft has overestimated the functionality of its hardware and native Bluetooth hardware. Very bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: derfsky

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, but gets too dirty
customer_reviews.text: Feels great to type in, great battery like and connectivity. However, the cushioned palm rests gets dirty. I wash my hands all the time and work on a clean office environment, but it got like in the picture anyway. Not sure if it's dirt or just worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Keyboard That Does Its Job & Saves Your Wrists
customer_reviews.text: No connectivity issues, responsive tactile feel, and great ergonomic design. As a professional developer who types all day (100 WPM+) having the right keyboard and fit matters to me. While it is not as responsive as many mechanical lever keyboards the ergonomic design is a life saver. Three weeks of typing on this keyboard and my carpal tunnel flare up is resolved. With a split design I may type at 90% of my original speed but it's 100% pain free.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: This is the Ergonomic Keyboard You have been wanting
customer_reviews.text: I love how this keyboard has not strayed too much from the original Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboards. I started using these when they came out in 1994, and this is my only my 3rd. So they have a long life. Of course this is by far the best, it is totally wireless and BlueTooth and just took one click to have it connect. It was fast and simple. The keyboard is the best, small newer key design and mechanicals make it the best of the best. Checkout my video below.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio

customer_reviews.title: Complete and utter garbage. Repeats characters endlessly
customer_reviews.text: Complete and utter garbage. Repeats characters endlessly. Drops connectivity while in the middle of typing. Read the negative reviews, they're all true. This product should never have been released as there was clearly nowhere near enough testing. But hey, it looks nice. And if MS Support actually replies, yes I've looked at all the links on your support page that you've pasted into other comments. And yeah, I've fully up to date on Windows 10 and using BT 4. This thing is just junk.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C. Skaryd

customer_reviews.title: Showed signs of wear and dirty, new in box.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I've purchased. One for work, and one for home. I love this keyboard. Nothing I've found comes close to it's look and feel. That being said, the one I received was covered in some sort of substance and had signs of wear on the Alcantara pad. It's like it was soaked in salt water, sun bleached, and then came out of it's case inside a bag for a cross country road trip. The box is perfect, no signs of damage. I'm returning mine, and getting a different one from the Microsoft store like the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: It worked great right out the box
customer_reviews.text: The world is officially turned upside down. I bought a Microsoft keyboard for my MacBook Pro. I guess Jony Ives thinks it’s more important to make keyboards that fit apples design aesthetic than are ergonomically functional for users. It worked great right out the box. Apple users, don’t be afraid to switch. I love this keyboard. Sorry Jony.
customer_reviews.author: David Mckimmie

customer_reviews.title: wrong keyboard layout, beware
customer_reviews.text: this is the uk/ie/gb keyboard layout which does not match the product image here
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: on OSX, requires a tool like Karabiner
customer_reviews.text: Attached is a photo of Karabiner settings for swapping the alt and command keys in OSX (Mojave in my case). Was disappointed that the keyboard didn't show up in native settings, so needed to use a third-party tool. As others have reviewed, the summary is that this is a decent keyboard but sells at a premium price. It's plastic and flexes like crazy. It's missing a lot of extras available in its previous models. These can all be mitigated by hacks, but for the price this shouldn't be an issue. If sold at $60 this wouldn't have so many complaints. At $120 (non-sale price) customers expect a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: nishi

customer_reviews.title: Best Yet in a Long Line of solid Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboards
customer_reviews.text: I've long been a fan and user of Microsoft's ergonomic keyboards and this is the most comfortable version yet. Yes, it does take a few days to get used to the exact key placement, which does differ from the 4000 wireless ergonomic keyboard, but the few days of hitting the Caps Key when I wanted to hit the A key were worth it. I LOVE this keyboard - soft hand rest is luxurious and the feel of the keys is terrific - and more importantly, my hands love this keyboard. A++ Microsoft. Thank you for staying in the keyboard business.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alper

customer_reviews.title: I’m impressed a slightly disappointed at the same time!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this keyboard for a week now and I must say it’s very comfortable. The light travel distance allows me to type faster than my roccat Vulcan 120 rgb gaming keyboard every single time. I’ve also tried other ergonomic keyboards and regular keyboards before. Bluetooth is okay, it’s just if it wakes up from inactivity there’s a anignifcant lag before registering all the key presses. I use this for my laptop since I can’t stand laptop keyboards when coding. Also, I’m worried the palm support rest will get dirty over time because I’ve seen tons of pics where it gets nasty even just after 30 days!
customer_reviews.author: CK.

customer_reviews.title: It works with OSX after a bunch of tinkering and some third-party software
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard does not easily pair with OSX (High Sierra 10.13.6) but it does pair after a bunch of trial and error. The function keys will not remap in the Settings > Keyboard. You need to install Karabiner, google it. I searched for an hour reading about everyone's struggles. Karabiner is the answer. After all of the pain, I would say that this keyboard does feel like an upgrade over the previous generation MS Sculpt, in part to having the number keypad back. 3 Stars, It's not aluminum. That's so dumb!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B.

customer_reviews.title: Back to my MS Ergonomic 4000
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use on a Windows 10 PC and it was terrible. Communication regularly cut out. It seems the keyboard goes to sleep pretty quickly and takes an annoying amount of time to wake up. I am really tired of all of these wireless keyboards. Give us a friggin wire! The computer is right there! Sick of signal interference, poor compatibility, bluetooth farts, dead batteries, etc! Take a page from the Logitech book and give me a wireless keyboard with an optional plug for charging and *GASP* keyboard connectivity!
customer_reviews.author: SynePDX

customer_reviews.title: Squeeks a bit, but otherwise a nice keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is a bit squeaky. Beyond that it was everything I expect. I am afraid to let my hands rest on the fabric due to all the reviews out there talking about how dirty it gets. My sculpt keyboard got dirty so I am proactive with this one. I'd have been happier with something more durable. I do wish the keyboard could be used on a desktop PC with the bios. Sadly being bluetooth this keyboard is not suitable as your only keyboard for a desktop computer. Key layout is great and I like how the function key works.
customer_reviews.author: Nickel Uss

customer_reviews.title: Listing does not indicate that this is a UK English version, not a U.S. English version
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this twice (hoping the first time was just a mistake). While the photo shows a U.S. English version of the keyboard, and the box does as well, it is actually a UK English version (there is a small sticker on the box). It is entirely possible I missed it, but nowhere in the listing for the product did I see that it says it's a UK English keyboard. Having ordered it, and now had to return it, twice, I'm very disappointed. And still without a wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect transition from corded Natural KB.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I’ve been using MS Natural corded keyboard for a decade, I think, and it’s my keyboard of choice. I have the corded one at work as well. I decided to redo my office and make my keyboard and mouse cordless and wanted a cleaner aesthetic look. This definitely accomplished that. The keys are smooth and Bluetooth works well (pc under thick desk). It has a little delay in the beginning when pc is turned on, but after that all is well.
customer_reviews.author: DailyGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good for iMac apple products
customer_reviews.text: Just received on Jan 26th, exactly what I was expecting. I am use to using an ergo keyboard at work and on my other desktops I have at home. I purchased this particular keyboard my iMac and despite what the answers that was given to me stating it wouldn't work, I decided to get it anyway. So far it has worked perfectly and the feel of it is amazing. I would recommend this keyboard for and iMac or any other computer, perfect especially if your already use to using an ergo keyboard. No complaints from me...another satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Takeia W

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy This, Nothing Better
customer_reviews.text: I have been in Technology and beyond for decades. I must have a perfect situation ergonomically, as well as with respect to sound and function. I use keyboards so aggressively that an exhorbanent cost is also undesirable. The keys are perfectly sized and spaced, having the ergo slant very close to a standard ergonomic keyboard you would expect. The key motion allow for a softer, smoother delivery to provide quiet environment. It prevents fatigue and allows me to type during conference calls without being heard. I rarely write reviews but this is one of my favorite, most critical things, as I am guessing to a keyboard for most of my waking hours. This keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Choir Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable keyboard with some minor nitpicks
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard in Microsoft's split natural ergonomic style. I've used all but the Sculpt and really like the feel of this device. The key travel is satisfying and comfortable. The wrist wrest is very comfortable as well. I've only had one hiccup with connectivity but that may be related to my PC occasionally having fits with sleep mode--I had to remove and reinsert the batteries. I took one star off for the key spacing of the arrow keys and lack of options to angle the board.
customer_reviews.author: L. S. Chasteen

customer_reviews.title: Great product, if you only connect to one computer.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but I wish it supported muktiple Bluetooth connection profiles. I have a workstation which I switch between laptops (work and personal). My mouse is simple to switch tap a button to change the stored connection. Everyone I switch keyboards though I need to reconnect Bluetooth connection. Tedious.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan O

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but poorly manufactured & quality-checked
customer_reviews.text: Design is excellent, and it looks beautiful. However, the unit we got: (1) Has a "soft" Y key - key press is completely different from all other keys, and seems mechanically defective. (2) Has the @ sign and double-quote keys interchanged. The #2 key has double-quote above it; and the single-quote key has the @ sign above it. How can you have such poor manufacturing quality checks?! Unfortunately we have purchased this as we have to work from home during the COVID crisis; and we do not have the luxury of going through the long process of requesting a refund and shopping for another keyboard. We will never buy another Microsoft hardware product.
customer_reviews.author: Vikram D'Mello

customer_reviews.title: I like the shape and feel of the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Still a little torn on this. I like the shape and feel of the keyboard. I wish it was a little taller or had some kind of braces for underneath. I have the MS Sculpt and I like the bracket they have underneath to elevate the front of the keyboard. As far as I know, the Surface doesn't have anything like that and it lays flat on the desk. I also had some initial problems with bluetooth interference but it's stabilized now. Really nice keyboard. though. Still like it better than the Sculpt which was my go-to previously.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Valentine

customer_reviews.title: very hard keys
customer_reviews.text: The shape is indeed outstanding, and the build quality very good, the big problem is that the key press feels very hard on the fingers. There's little travel, which would still be fine if there was a bit of cushioning in the keys, but there is none, it feels like you're hitting a hard desk surface. I personally sent it back, with regret because it has potential, but the key press was a deal breaker. I should add that I work as a programmer so I do more than just occasional typing..
customer_reviews.author: wonderchild94

customer_reviews.title: A worthy wireless successor to the Natural 4000
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic keyboard. I've been using thefor many years. This keyboard is a worthy wireless replacement. Likes: - Not black - Satisfying mechanical resistance to keypresses without being loud - Comfortable - Looks gorgeous Dislikes: - Somewhat different than the 4000, takes a few days to adjust to. - Every few days I have to turn on/off bluetooth on my MacBook Pro to get it to recognize the keyboard, though I bet this is a Mac problem not a keyboard problem since I have to do the same for my bluetooth mouse - I wish it also had a USB dongle option
customer_reviews.author: gabe

customer_reviews.title: Broken F2 key, can't type very fast on this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Chiclets keys feel good, but I'm not able to type as fast as I'd like. If you are a typist and need high WPM, find a good mechanical keyboard. The ergonomics feel good and the wrist rest is super comfy. My keyboard had a QA issue where the F2 key would stay 'stuck' down if I pressed it near the top. For $130, I expected better QA.
customer_reviews.author: h41cyon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic feel but terrible quality, very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the weird material for the wrist rest, this would be the perfect quiet smooth typing keyboard but we had to return 2 in a row because they malfunctioned. Either keys would not type or would stutter type. Very disappointing. At a premium price, quality should be high
customer_reviews.author: SD1901

customer_reviews.title: One o Microsoft best products
customer_reviews.text: This feels good with the spacing and the keyboard has a lot of short cut options. This is better than the keyboard that came with the Surface Studio. No complaints on the soft material part and I dont see it picking up any grime. Time will tell. I use Energizer rechargeable batteries on all my Microsoft products and haven't had an issues with those.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Begging for better firmware...
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard but hate having to set up the bluetooth connection almost every single day... why does it keep on disconnecting mysteriously?
customer_reviews.author: Charles Yu

customer_reviews.title: Best ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I used a Microsoft ergonomic keyboard the previous one ( not wireless ) for several years. It was perfect after I felt comfortable with the ergonomic format. Anyway, after the keyboard, I've used several keyboards that are made of different switches. But I feel ergonomic is the best for my posture when it comes to especially my shoulder pains. This one is perfect for this problem, and also I feel comfortable with the feeling of typing without any noise. I use Ubuntu for my desktop, so I worried about the Bluetooth connection, but it is totally fine. ( But as an Ubuntu user, you should find a way as always. :) ).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and ergonomic setup
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. It offers me a comfortable way to type work emails all day while I deal with carpal tunnel in my dominant hand (right). The keyboard arrived in great shape. I bought a used keyboard via Amazon, and it shipped quickly. The only negative thing I have to say is that there is a tiny bump on the left space bar (I guess a small manufacturing defect of this particular keyboard). I covered it with masking tape and don’t notice it now when I type. It took a day or two to get used to typing this way, but I am used to it now. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: MSteel

customer_reviews.title: A nice full function keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a 5 star except for the following two reasons: The characters on the keys do not stand out in low light. The last ergonomic board that I had was higher at the number line than the zxcvb line. That made it more comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Anjinsama

customer_reviews.title: Spacebar squeaks like crazy
customer_reviews.text: Love the form and the ergonomics. Got it setup on my Mac with minimal tweaking. However the right half of the spacebar squeaks when pressed and it's LOUD. If I'm not wearing headphones it's borderline infuriating after 10 mins of work. Other reviews said the had the same issue, got a replacement, and it also squeaks. So it's obviously a known issue. I really love the keyboard itself, but the squeaking.... I may end up chunking it in the closet here shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Callaghan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent keyboard that unfortunately does not work with my MacBook Pro. If you’re looking for a quiet keyboard to pair with your Windows device, then it’s a perfect match.
customer_reviews.author: Irfan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointingly loud.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard looks great but many of the keys, the space bar in particular, squeak or chirp loudly when used. It's bad enough that I can't type on web calls because people start asking where that cricket noise is coming from. I'm very disappointing. I've had the sculpt keyboard from Microsoft for a long time and was expecting at least the same performance from this, especially given the price premium. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: pmpm2000

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard I've used.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly ergonomic, great quality, I couldn't ask for a better keyboard. Note that I don't game on PC, so I can't speak to it for that use case.
customer_reviews.author: SimpliiD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard but you need to remove then re-pair when switching between laptops
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this keyboard! But why on earth would you make it gray? The wrist rest looks dirty right away. Huge mistake. The split spacebar is a HUGE improvement from the ergo 4000 (used for 15+ yrs). Love the chicklet style keys, I can type really fast with this keyboard except when reaching for the backspace, I keep hitting the insert key! Drives me crazy!! The only other real big downfall is that it can only be paired with one laptop at a time. When I switch between laptops I always have to remove the keyboard first then re-pair it every time. So annoying :(
customer_reviews.author: Liz E

customer_reviews.title: "Package contains UK English key layout"
customer_reviews.text: Received a keyboard with UK English keyboard layout. The one pictured is US keyboard layout.
customer_reviews.author: alan d manuel

customer_reviews.title: This is truly one of the most comfortable keyboards ever and it also has a beautiful design
customer_reviews.text: This is truly one of the most comfortable keyboards ever and it also has a beautiful design. It worked perfectly with my Surface, but not with my ASUS desktop computer (even though it supposedly had the correct version of Bluetooth). I ended up returning it and switching to the black Sculpt ergonomic keyboard, which shares the same layout at this keyboard, but has a separate number pad. If you are using a Surface device, this is the keyboard to get.
customer_reviews.author: Stanpec

customer_reviews.title: Good feel but problem coming out of sleep
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Microsoft Surface Ergonomic Keyboard as a replacement for my Microsoft 4000 Ergonomic (corded) keyboard. I tried connecting it to both a Microsoft Surface Book and my new desktop (with built in Bluetooth). Although I could get it connected and typing it had a major problem of going to "sleep" about 15 seconds after I finished typing a sentence. It would then take about 15 seconds to come back from sleep which was unusable. I called support to see if the sleep timeout could be altered and after 3 phone calls to Microsoft I gave up. Sending this keyboard back.
customer_reviews.author: ahawksfan

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard but didn't work with my Windows 10 computer
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful and super ergonomic keyboard. I wish I could have kept it, but the Bluetooth didn't work with my Windows 10 PC. I'm not an overly technical person and didn't realize that the Bluetooth on my computer wasn't compatible. However, the seller is awesome. When I initiated the return, they showed me additional keyboard options that they had available for exchange. One of the them, a Logitech Ergo K860, is a perfect match to this keyboard, and it offers both Bluetooth and USB connections. I haven't received it yet, but I'm hopeful it will work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Issues
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard 10 months ago. It started randomly disconnecting from blue tooth this week. And then the L key stopped working completely. It had barely been used till I started working from 5 weeks ago. I am hoping it is under warranty and can be returned. I am extremely unhappy with how well it has not held up.
customer_reviews.author: JessW

customer_reviews.title: ... laptop (not a Microsoft Surface) and it works just fine. Even the function keys work as they are ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Windows 10 laptop (not a Microsoft Surface) and it works just fine. Even the function keys work as they are labeled. As for usability... it's pretty awesome. Definitely easier on the hands for typing.My only gripe is the placement of the function key, which pushes the alt and Windows button keys further to the right. Just takes some time to adjust to.
customer_reviews.author: robaroo

customer_reviews.title: My wrist thank me for this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many copies of the Natural Keyboard from Microsoft over the years. This one is as good as any of them. I have never had a connection problem to my Surface Studio 2, it's almost as they were meant for each other. The one down side is the microfiber palm rest has to be cleaned to keep it looking good but care instructions are easy to find online.
customer_reviews.author: Halyeah

customer_reviews.title: Better than standard keyboards.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is not as big as the one I gave a milk bath to. I will adjust to it in time. Other than the smaller size, it is so much better than the standard keyboards that come with computers.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Kinner

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant buying this keyboard when I read reviews stating that it doesn't transmit keystrokes as it comes out of the sleep state. This is definitely not the case. I've never had a problem with the keyboard, and it doesn't lose any keystrokes. It is true, however, that you can't use the keyboard to wake the computer up. You'll need to wiggle a mouse or click your computer's power button for that.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L

customer_reviews.title: Overall great keyboard, though you must always have clean hands ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall great keyboard, though you must always have clean hands before using, otherwise if you are like me and have 'hot' hands. Then you'll notice yellow spots with minor usage Added pictures. Left side spots are under left-ctrl and left alt. And right side under the right ctrl and left arrow key
customer_reviews.author: Diego Madero

customer_reviews.title: Solid wireless ergo keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Have three weeks of daily work use under the belt. Good keyboard, like the tactile feel though the flat keys took a bit of getting used to. Construction feels solid and materials are nice - clean, modern look. Connectivity is easy with windows 10, though I had some trouble connecting Bluetooth with one older laptop.
customer_reviews.author: maos

customer_reviews.title: Like the keyboard, but wrong country layout
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape and design, but I received the British EU version (SKU 3SQ‐00010). The different symbol layout was frustrating, so I contacted support for a replacement... and the replacement was another British version, with a different SKU than what's on the listing (which is the U.S. version). Giving up and returning for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Kels

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, low key touch, but separated key zones
customer_reviews.text: I did like this keyboard, because of the low touch keys and the curvature, BUT I just couldn't get used to big gap in the middle, and I kept hitting the wrong keys here and there. I wish I could find an ergonomic, curved keyboard with low touch keys, but they do not exist from all my research. Not sure why, but 99% of ergonomic keyboards have the TALL keys, which is fine if you are a relatively fast typist, but if you are, it is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: William Rindone

customer_reviews.title: company didn't respond to my repeated requests for help! AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: Although the keyboard worked well for a few weeks, it stopped connecting to my MacBook Pro shortly thereafter. When I tried to contact the company to replace it (as Microsoft support told me to do), they ignored me. They ignored a 2nd attempt to contact them as well. That being said, MS eventually sent me a replacement directly (after many phone calls). HOWEVER, the replacement had a broken spacebar (one of them was stuck in the down position). No matter how you slice it, the keyboard and company suck. Avoid them at all costs. Purchase at your own peril!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: No wrist pain
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard price seemed high however after using it for a month it is worth it. It is smooth and have not had a single bit of wrist pain since I started using it. It is well made and the battery seems to last a long time. It has not had any issues for the month I have had it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Better than the last Microsoft Sculpt keyboard but...
customer_reviews.text: Better than the Microsoft Sculpt keyboard as the "F" keys are real (though small) and not buttons that are hard to press but... The caps lock LED is hard to see (dim white on light grey) and its too easy to hit the "F" lock button at the lower left of the keyboard. They also put the Print Screen and Delete key bunched up next to the Backspace and it's really hard to get used to. :( Also, it randomly dumps a key over and over like it's held down.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Total pain
customer_reviews.text: We needed to pair with 2 different laptops. One was a Mac, the other a PC. Originally connected without any issues. To connect to either one became a pain. Had to go through the whole pairing sequence again and again.
customer_reviews.author: ToKeeKee

customer_reviews.title: So far I LOVE the keyboard and have not experienced any of the ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I LOVE the keyboard and have not experienced any of the bluetooth issues that others have. Pros: Like the sculpt but without the number pad that wanders all over the place. Cons: I do miss the sculpt's option to elevate the front of the keyboard and the palm rest is difficult to keep clean (I had never realized how disgustingly dirty my palms are).
customer_reviews.author: NNN

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have difficulty using a straight keyboard and have always purchase an ergonomic model as an additional piece of equipment. The key stroke and depression sound level of this model, as compared to the older, plug-in version, is considerably less and is virtually silent. This is the perfect replacement for my old Microsoft keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Nice, shallow keys, and low latency.
customer_reviews.text: It's so hard to find a wireless keyboard with a low enough latency to do what I do (closed captioning from home, where syncing the caption groups up to what's being said is an important part, and requires there to be no keyboard latency). It has a firm base that doesn't flex, and has enough weight to stay put, even typing at 120 AWPM. Jury's still out on the battery life, but after putting in a few dozen hours in on this keyboard, I'm not experiencing any issues with a weak signal or missing keystrokes.
customer_reviews.author: CringeFan

customer_reviews.title: Great feel  and action
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. The low key profile and action is great. The Bluetooth connectivity takes a few seconds to get going when the PC first wakes up, but it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard! Key strokes are smooth and it's very comfortable to use. Purchased this bluetooth connector and it works perfectly with my Windows 10 desktop at work. Couldn't be much simpler to install.
customer_reviews.author: Hillbilly Jedi

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a laptop keyboard, but ergonomic!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I've ever used. A definite step up from the Microsoft wired ergonomic keyboard. The keys have a laptop keyboard feel. Don't have to press as hard or deep to get keys to register. And it's quiet which my coworkers I know will appreciate. It's definitely worth the price and typing is a joy again.
customer_reviews.author: carrie

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Initially bought this for work. Loved it so much a bought another one for home use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. Long

customer_reviews.title: So far it helped me with carpel tunnel
customer_reviews.text: It does helped preventing the increasing pain of my hand, that’s all. But when it comes to connection, since it not designed for Mac, I’m paying the price of once it gets disconnected It takes a lot of time to re- pair again. And material wise? It easily catches dirt, but I’m weighing in between trouble of connection plus dirt to less pain? I’ll chose the latter.
customer_reviews.author: Al Ways Write

customer_reviews.title: This product works great when it is working
customer_reviews.text: This product works great when it is working, but it randomly stops working. I would not suggest it to anyone who has to use their keyboard a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Cuchine

customer_reviews.title: A decent keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent ergo keyboard, I didn’t use it for long, but it was sturdy with OK key travel. The wrist rest seems like it would get dirty/wear out though. If I needed a new ergo keyboard in the future I would consider this, but the Sculpt would be a cheaper, and equally likely contender.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my wife
customer_reviews.text: She is using this with a Dell laptop. Connected up with no effort on my part. She uses a corded ergonomic kb on her other system and really likes this one. One less wire to manage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything about sleeping mode. But I love the color, ergonomic part of it and of course because it is Bluetooth. I can use it with my tablet. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L.

customer_reviews.title: Product is good but risk of getting used to key positions
customer_reviews.text: The product is good and feels comfortable. But i returned it since I didn't want to get used to the keys position. It started affecting my typing on MacBook keyboard. I later ordered mechanical keyboard with hand rest.
customer_reviews.author: shashank b

customer_reviews.title: but I like the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Hasn't revolutionized my life, but I like the keyboard. Seems well crafted, connects well, is responsive in both physical feedback and types with no apparent lag or anything. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Fike

customer_reviews.title: Nice board. Rigid and stable on the desk
customer_reviews.text: Nice board. Rigid and stable on the desk. The wrist rest looks like felt but it is not, it's soft but doesn't collect dirt. I had been using the MSFT 4000 series for years and while the spacing is a little different on this it's pretty easy to adjust to.
customer_reviews.author: G. M.

customer_reviews.title: I fell in love with the Surface style of keyboard when I got ...
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with the Surface style of keyboard when I got my first Surface tablet (Surface 3 - which I still use), and this keyboard brings that same smooth, quiet action with small travel distance to the game. It's everything I wanted to get out of a keyboard with the Surface branding on it. I bought this a couple months ago, and I'm still on my first set of batteries under heavy daily use as a gamer and programmer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard.  Bluetooth connectivity is an issue however
customer_reviews.text: I love the keyboard. Should get five stars but... problem is the Bluetooth connectivity. I am using a regular PC with a Bluetooth USB adapter which is purchased separately from another manufacturer. Continuous problems with the connection where it freezes or goes off. Bought a second USB Bluetooth adapter and still having issues. I think Microsoft should provide a full solution instead of something that you have to cobble together. Have spent a fair amount of time trying to resolve but still having issues.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Yosowitz

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get a Low Energy bluetooth dongle!  It is not supplied with one.
customer_reviews.text: I love the keyboard, but got it home before I realized it didn't come with a Bluetooth transmitter. So I had to go back to Best Buy (10 mi. away) and buy a Bluetooth 4.0 that they told me I needed. Then I found out that the Bluetooth had to be "Low Energy" because of the type of signal needed by the keyboard. This time, I had to order one online because I don't have a store near me that is that sophisticated. I would have paid more for it to be included and not have to go through all the trouble!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis K.

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky Space bar irritates my coworkers
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the keyboard has an annoying loud squeak on the right spacebar. I've kept using it and hoped it will go way eventually, but it's been more than six months and it's still irritating my neighbors and embarrassing me. total bummer because it is otherwise a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two different keyboards to WFH. This was nice, it kept the other. Keyboards are a personal thing for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard did not connect to Windows 10 by bluetooth so I went and bought an additonal $20 USB and it worked but everything was delayed.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Newby

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard for my MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Took a second to set up with my MacBook Pro, but once I got it working it was perfect. Love this keyboard. Keys are light and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Himayv

customer_reviews.title: Great and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit of getting used to, but now a “regular” keyboard seems odd. Have had no issues with connectivity. Seems quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: Sadly unusable
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the companion mouse, the keyboard doesn't have an on,off switch and simply will not reconnect when you restart your computer. Bummer, such a nice comfortable keyboard, but useless.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Paul

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a product to replace an older version that I had used until it stopped working. Keyboard is awesome. Ergonomic and easy to use wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Edel

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating intermittent disconnections
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this keyboard. I have a Surface Pro 4, so I expected the bluetooth connection to work flawlessly. It doesn't. If there's an interval of inactivity, the keyboard will go into some kind of sleep mode and reconnecting can take 5-30s, which is incredibly frustrating. Go with a wired keyboard. Microsoft hasn't figured out bluetooth yet.
customer_reviews.author: Eliyah Finkelstein

customer_reviews.title: i love it.
customer_reviews.text: i love it... i think bluethooth is not as good as having a physical receiver, but other than that it works good, and looks even better!!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard with ergonomic design
customer_reviews.text: All in all this is a great keyboard for people used to the split ergonomic style The keyboard does not have an independent number block (some people might prefer that of course) and is not height adjustable in the front like the "Microsoft Sculpt Ergonomic Keyboard for Business". I would prefer both options, but I just kept the independent number block from the previous keyboard around.
customer_reviews.author: Matthias Goetzke

customer_reviews.title: Not even ergonomic, terrible experience pairing to a brand new Lenovo computer
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy. It's not ergonomic. The curvature of the keyboard is not such that you can call this an ergonomic product. Poorly conceived and designed. Your hand will fall off the edge rather than resting on the pad which is a major issue for an ergo product. I wasn't able to pair the device with one of my PCs for no reason. Microsoft is no help.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Barbeau

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: tried three of these and they were wonderful but broke down after a month or so. Not worth the money won't buy again. Stuck with a broken one in the office, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Don J. West

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I like using this ergonomic keyboard and keep buying it every year or so because it has a subtle shape. The keyboard is a good match for being ergonomic, but not the extreme version. On Con is the letters rub off in about a year. The most-used alphabet keys are the first to go, left had has the most. If the manufacturer could slightly depress the letters and fill with the white lettering, it would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: MaxCO

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my new keyboard. It's my first time using ergonomic keyboards so I'm still adjusting but I know it's important for me to switch for the sake of my wrists. Extremely elegant and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't get this if you have an Apple computer...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible Mac support, tried all the tricks I could find online, but the keyboard constantly goes to sleep even between keystrokes. While it looks cool it does not get the job done sadly. I had used the MS Wired Ergo keyboard for years. Was really hoping this would be the next great thing, but not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Connects seamlessly with Lenovo Windows 10, comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and easy to adapt to. Connects easily to my Lenovo in moments. Moving from my laptop keyboard this is a huge improvement. I've been using it all week and have had no connectivity issues. LOVE this keyboard. My hands feel much better already.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Peaslee

customer_reviews.title: outstanding  and I thought it would not be
customer_reviews.text: love the feel of the key board and the ergonomic array was hard to get used to but wonderful once you have it down.
customer_reviews.author: Jiasong

customer_reviews.title: Great Feeling - But space bar was squeeky. and gets dirty easy
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of this product, but the space bar was squeeky and annoying. Also, the wrist rest gets dirty way to easy
customer_reviews.author: Justin Massion

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality but sometimes blacks out
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly well mostly. Paired semi-easily to my Mac without much trouble, except the pairing key needs to be entered on the num pad, not the number row. However, it can sometimes stop communicating with the machine for a few seconds. Still my daily driver.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Got it paired - eventually!
customer_reviews.text: Lovely keyboard to use, once you get it paired. It would not pair to my Surface Pro tablet, but eventually after hours of Googling, found the problem: a phantom keyboard in my list of devices. Deleted that and all is good. The Bluetooth connection is reliable, and I love using it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Eassom

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love how it feels but I wish Microsoft made a black version oh well...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not pair with Macbook --but highly recommended for PC
customer_reviews.text: Would not pair with Macbook. Otherwise, excellent. I would recommend highly for PC
customer_reviews.author: PrivacyPlease

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it - just wish it was a bit cheaper ... like everything else 😁
customer_reviews.author: Venky

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is awesome, no dongle required and sleeps when the computer is inactive saving the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Branden Boyak

customer_reviews.title: Disconnected a lot
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst keyboard I've ever purchased. It disconnects a lot. I am fed up and going to use my old keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Pouyan

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love these so much I got three. Really easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: john coffman

product_meta.title: Microsoft 3RA-00022 Surface Ergonomic Keyboard,Gray
product_meta.description: Microsoft 3RA-00022 Surface Ergonomic Keyboard.QWERTY key life: 10,000,000 actuations per key.
feature_bullets: Compatible with Surface Pro 4, Surface Book, Surface Studio
Double-cushioned palm rest covered in stunning Alcantara

Interface: Bluetooth Low Energy compatible 4. 0/4. 1. Operating system: Windows 10: Works with Bluetooth Smart Ready Device with Human Interface Device (HID) support. Top-line system requirements: Requires a PC that meets the requirements for and has Windows 10
Wireless frequency is 2. 400 MHz to 2483. 5 MHz. Wireless range is up to 32 feet

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars570 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
